headline: Ingenuity: Damage puts end to ground-breaking Mars helicopter mission

annotations.paragraph: Nasa's Ingenuity Mars helicopter, which made history by achieving the first powered flight on another world, has suffered mission-ending damage.
annotations.reason: Introduces the main event of the mission-ending damage to Ingenuity.

annotations.paragraph: In a statement, Nasa said the aircraft was forced to perform an "emergency landing" that damaged its rotors.
annotations.reason: Provides specific details about the damage and the emergency landing.

annotations.paragraph: The space agency's Bill Nelson said the aircraft was "the little helicopter that could" and had racked up far more flights than had been intended.
annotations.reason: Offers a quote that highlights the helicopter's achievements and unexpected longevity.

annotations.paragraph: He said Ingenuity had "paved the way for future flight in our Solar System".
annotations.reason: Provides context on the significance of Ingenuity's mission for future space exploration.
Image credit with no contribution to the narrative.

annotations.paragraph: Ingenuity is said to remain "upright" but images showed that "one or more of its rotor blades" were damaged and it was "no longer capable of flight".
annotations.reason: Provides specific details about the damage to Ingenuity.

annotations.paragraph: Nasa said the circumstances were being investigated.
annotations.reason: Mentions ongoing investigation related to the main event.

annotations.paragraph: "Ingenuity has paved the way for future flight in our Solar System, and it's leading the way for smarter, safer human missions to Mars and beyond," Mr Nelson, the Nasa administrator, said in a video message on social media.
annotations.reason: Offers a quote from a NASA official about Ingenuity's impact.

annotations.paragraph: "That remarkable helicopter flew higher and farther than we ever imagined and helped Nasa do what we do best - make the impossible, possible."
annotations.reason: Provides a general statement about Ingenuity's achievements.

annotations.paragraph: Ingenuity reached the Red Planet in February 2021 by riding on the belly of the Perseverance rover.
annotations.reason: Gives background information on how Ingenuity arrived on Mars.

annotations.paragraph: It was meant to be on a short technology demonstration to prove flight was possible in the ultra-thin Martian atmosphere.
annotations.reason: Provides context about the original purpose of the Ingenuity mission.

annotations.paragraph: The vehicle went on to support Perseverance in its exploration of Jezero Crater by previewing areas of Mars that might be of interest, helping the wheeled robot and its drivers on Earth pick the right path.
annotations.reason: Describes Ingenuity's role in supporting the Perseverance rover, which is relevant to its mission.

annotations.paragraph: Before its mission came to an end on Thursday, Ingenuity performed 72 flights and flew more than 14 times farther than originally planned.
annotations.reason: Provides specific details about the achievements of the Ingenuity mission.

annotations.paragraph: Many will mourn the passing of the plucky chopper but its withdrawal from service has probably come at the right time, the BBC's science correspondent Jonathan Amos says.
annotations.reason: Contains a low-information quote and general sentiment without adding new facts.

annotations.paragraph: The Perseverance rover is about to undertake some long, fast drives as it seeks to climb up on to the rim of Jezero Crater.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides context about the Perseverance rover's mission, which is relevant to understanding the challenges Ingenuity would face.

annotations.paragraph: If still functional, Ingenuity would, in all likelihood, have struggled to keep up with Perseverance, or at the very least held up the rover's exploration.
annotations.reason: This paragraph explains the potential impact of Ingenuity's damage on the Perseverance mission, directly relating to the headline.
